revised_title: Obituary Notices of Fellows Deceased: Arthur Connell, Edward Joshua Cooper, Joshua Field, and Richard Fowler
tldr: This article provides obituary notices for four notable individuals in the fields of astronomy, chemistry, and engineering. Arthur Connell was a chemist who contributed to mineral analysis and voltaic decompositions. Edward Joshua Cooper was an amateur astronomer who established the Markree Observatory and discovered the planet Metis. Joshua Field was a civil engineer and a founder of the Institution of Civil Engineers, known for his work in marine steam-engine construction. Richard Fowler was a physician and a member of the Royal Society, who contributed to the study of animal electricity.
scientific_discipline: Biographies > History of Science and Scientific Figures
